ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

Notes: 1 = Very satisfied; 2 = Satisfied; 3 = Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied; 4 = Dissatisfied; 5 = Very dissatisfied; 888 = Hidden - no answer

ElementDescription: We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Problem or situation wasn't serious enough?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Didn't think anyone could help?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Thought involving others might ruin relationship with the other person?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Worried that involving others would cause even more problems (harm instead of help)?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Didn't know where to go for help?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Cost (such as paying for professional help)?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Didn't have the time (such as due to work or childcare duties)?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Some other reason?

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Some other reason (specify)

We want to understand why people may not reach out for help when they experience difficulties like the ones you've shared with us. Which of the following contributed to your not reaching out for help?  (Select all that apply): Hidden - no answer?
